title: Quick Gameplay Thoughts: July 14
body:
Hi folks,

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Usual Disclaimers**

These posts will often contain talk about future work we're doing, or planning to do, that isn't yet guaranteed to ship. The nature of the work could change or, depending on what we discover, projects mentioned may get put delayed or even stopped.
If you'd like to see a Tweet whenever a new one of these posts goes up: https://twitter.com/RiotMeddler

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Approach we're taking with 7.15/Qualifiers**

First off, quick update, was talking with some of our Esports folks and they mentioned some of the qualifiers will likely be played on 7.16, rather than all of them on 7.15 (LPL seems most likely from the sounds of it).

Secondly, wanted to talk a bit more about the approach we're taking with pro balance for the coming patch. We're looking at groups of champions more than usual, with a few observations driving a lot of our changes and then a number of one offs. What we're currently looking into therefore looks like:

* Jungle - Belief is that it's more appropriate to bring the top junglers down a bit than trying to buff others up to their level. That means smallish nerfs to Lee Sin, Gragas, Elise, Rek'Sai and Zac are being looked at. That also has the added benefit of bringing jungler impact overall down slightly, in addition to hopefully being the better way to see some more diversity.

* Mid Lane - Looks to be in a reasonable spot overall, so here we're targeting specific champs we think could get into the competitive pool. That means buffs to TF, Ekko, Ziggs, Xerath and potentially one or two more. We haven't seen artillery champs in pro play much for a while, Jayce excepted, so are hoping to get a bit of spot play on one or two. Buffs will be pretty light though, so that's more a hope than an expectation however.

* Champs we've adjusted recently - We're watching, but not yet testing changes for, a number of champs we've recently nerfed. Those are competitive staples recently like Galio or Caitlyn. Want to make sure we've trimmed then down enough but don't want to swing at them again if that's not needed. On the other side of things also watching a couple of champs we've recently buffed who are getting a bunch of pro play, Gnar being the biggest example

* Misc champs - Finally we're also just exploring some minor tune ups/tune downs for a few miscellanious champs we think are either a bit strong or could be pro viable with smaller work. Thresh (-), Nami (+), Jinx (+), GP (+)  are good examples of that.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Singed Hotfix**

As a lot of you will have noticed we hotfixed nerfed Singed yesterday. Buffs for him gave him much more power than we'd predicted so we felt it necessary to take some power off him quickly. Urgency there was particularly high given that high performance wasn't just experienced Singed players doing well, but happening even with a lot of people with limited Singed experience jumping onto the changes, indicating power when played effectively was noticeably higher again. We're glad to see Singed in a stronger spot, and that was one of the big goals of the recent changes, but that doesn't mean any magnitude of buff was appropriate and this one overshot quite a bit. More thoughts on his state to follow once the patch has been out a decent amount of time.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Hotfixing in General**

For anyone unfamiliar with the term a hotfix is a quick change to the game outside of the normal patch cycle that often doesn't require the player to download a new patch (done on the server). They've got some added risk, so they're not a standard tool, with less time to test things both in terms of bugs and balance. If things are urgent they can be a good choice though.

We're planning to do slightly more hotfixes, in particular because we recently saw some tools changes get finished that reduce the risk of bugs from hotfixing and the amount of developer time they take to do. They're still a riskier tool, so won't become the standard way of rolling out changes, but it's much more likely you'll see a balance change or two following up after a patch goes out. Goal with those is primarily to adjust anything that had a much larger or smaller effect than we expected (e.g. correct extreme cases of overbuffed or overnerfed quicker). Those changes won't be aiming to fully solve a problem gebnerally though, both because of the limited testing time possible and because it's not clear enough what that would require shortly after a patch. Instead they'll be aimed at moderating the most out of line cases a bit before we give them a more extended analysis over a longer period of time.


-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Kayn**

Seems to be in an ok spot so far. We're seeing a lot of Kayns fail, that's very much expected for a new champ, especially a squishier melee one. Assassin Kayn seems to be struggling more than Darkin. That's somewhat expected off assassin being the harder to learn form, also possible there's too large a power difference between the two though. No immediate plans for balance changes, discrepancy between the two forms is one of the key things we'll be watching though. 



-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=A7LBtoKc,discussion-id=qXAN1k8U,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2017-07-14T16:10:05.575+0000)
> Also, walking through walls isn't as powerful as you seem to think it is. It's really useful, don't 

My question is, why he is allowed to dash over walls with his Q, if he can already freely pass them with E.

To comparsion I'd have champions with multiple dashes, like Lee Sin or Rakan. However those champions have some requirements to pass walls.

* Lee Sin - has to hit something with Q to use the dash; has to place a word or find an ally nearby to use the dash
* Rakan - can use W freely, what is fine, because the dash from his E has a requirement to find an allied champion nearby

Now I understand why Galio can't dash over walls, because he is tanky and it would take ages to kill him if he could get over walls, possibly same with Urgot - it'd be too annoying.

But Kayn can technically pass walls with 3 abilities: Q, E and ult (if he manages to find enemy champion nearby).
And also he can build tanky if he choses Darkin form, so he can be as tanky as Galio and Urgot at the times.

You are blowing it out of proportion

1.- Kayn's mobility is tied to him being out of combat (he can traverse an entire jungle section in assassin form with yellw boots). if he is in combat his e can only pass one short wall

2.- His Q also only passes through small walls, as well as putting on CD on of his most reliable damage outputs

3.- Ult is conditiones to getting in to do damage first, and if used wrong the "infested" enemy can carry you away from your team so he and his buddies beat you up

If anything Darkin Kayn is fine and assassin needs a more reliable escape/faster burst pattern
What was the plan with the Lux buffs that you mentioned on the 11th?
Overall buffs, but focused on team utility rather than comboing a target down (Q CD, W shield on allies).
It strikes me as a risk that Lux becomes too much of a generalist if she has both high damage, safety and high utility. Do you think she has clear enough weaknesses for this not to be a worry?

Her main damaging ability E has a cooldown of 10 seconds at all ranks. She has too long cooldowns for sustained damaged and usually can't one shot people at later stages due to Zhonyas, QSS, Banshees and Maw. 

She has a lot of weaknesses, I think those buffs are in the right direction because I'm assuming Q will still have quite a long cooldown so she can still be punished if it is missed. The W increase is for allies so she will not be able to abuse it herself because from Meddler's wording it seems like the shield on Lux is getting no buffs so you will still be able to easily trade with her and pop her.

>if she has both high damage, safety

She has safety? She has range sure, but I don't think that's quite the same as safety. She's squishy, completely immobile, and none of her damage happens fast so she relies on cc to hit people mostly. Her mana is garbage and she often has to choose between wave clear and fighting. Her damage is only high if she builds a ton of ap, making it difficult for her to build any defenses while still doing damage.

Why do you keep targeting Caitlyn's attack speed? It feels bad to play her now with Berserkers and 2 Zeal items leaving her at 1.4 attack speed at lvl 18. Please just nerf her traps over this, she feels so bad to use. Please just nerf traps and revert attack speed changes.

We think one of Cait's main problems is that she's too much of a generalist. For a safe champ, who's a lane bully, with some decent utility her single target damage later in the game (a core strength of other, narrower ADCs) has been too high, hence the AS hit.
But they want her to be a lane bully and other stuff. They don't want her to have so much single DPS.

Hi Meddler,

I think most people are frustrated with the AS nerf because it doesn't affect what they've found annoying about her. They'll still be just as annoyed by her after these nerfs.

I suggested making traps last a shorter time. I understand it doesn't change out-of-line single-target dmg. But it might hit two birds:

1. Less frustration in normal play (fewer traps to avoid in lane).
2. Less priority in pro play (if traps last significantly less time, it's much easier to break the Caitlyn siege or to take towers against her).

As a Caitlyn player, the AS hit _feels_ bad. I understand it might not actually _be_ bad. It just made her less fun to play—and I assume the enemies are still tilted when I kill them the 5th time when they're trying to CS under tower.

**So, I'm curious if you can open up the thinking behind why her single-target dmg was the prioritized issue, instead of some other (e.g., shorter trap life) solution being used that would affect the frustration people have with her?**


PS. Overall, I think balancing is done very well. And usually you find very good ways to make champs feel good, even after nerfs. That's why this one stood out to me as an odd one.

It's not about making her less annoying, it's about making her less well rounded. She's supposed to have extremely strong bullying/sieging power and that's why her range and traps are good. The reason they nerfed her AS is because she not only hadthose strengths, but also really high dps in late game fights. By nerfing her AS, she's allowed to keep her main strengths while also being forced to make a tradeoff with less DPS (By doing this you also open up chances for other ADCs with that late game dps to shine through, like Twitch or Jinx).
Have you considered hitting the ability of cait to chain w traps to a target, as a target doesn't actually get 4 seconds of immunity from her traps, as 2 seconds are used up by the 1st trap snare.

Because Cait should be like Jhin. Snipers don't get to attack as often as machine guns, but that one shot should have longer range and hit harder. Cait already has the long range and hard hit with headshot and traps, but the AS weakness wasn't pronounced enough for it to be significantly weaker than other ADCs

Is anything currently being worked on or planned in the future for Wukong?  He isn't in a terrible state by any means, but I feel he's a very one dimensional champion with a lot more potential.  Being one dimensional isn't necessarily bad I suppose, it's just boring for me personally, and I've been looking forward to a fighter class update ever since the class updates began; but now that they are done, I'm curious as to whether he might be seeing any meaningful changes in the future.  

P.S.  I've been playing pretty regularly since S3, and I'd like to say that Riot has gotten so much better at communicating with the player base since then, both in being more transparent about ongoing work on upcoming content and in providing justifications for changes that have or are about to be made.  This adds a lot to my experience and enjoyment with the game, and it's good for the community.  Thank you.

Please don't buff Ekko. Every time you guys do he ends up pick or ban. He's already popular in high elo and a reasonably common pick in competitive. What makes you think he needs a buff? Putting him in the same category as champs like TF and Xerath seems crazy. Those champs have been out of meta for like a full year whereas Ekko has been a decently popular since the assassin class update.

Ekko ends up too generically strong every time he gets buffed. He's supposed to be a niche pick with a particular set of unique skills and he's already fairly popular. In what sense does he need a buff? Please reconsider, the last thing I want is for Ekko to be pick / ban again and have to wait till you guys nerf him so I can play again.

I've deep concerns about buffing Xerath, as he seems to function in a near 'sleeper OP' state in my experience, and is one of the few picks I regard as such. Playing him is tricky, but once you're familiar with his pattern, his damage output capacity is absolutely insane. Giving him enough to compensate for the problems of pro play (where being counter picked and coordinated against is a more extreme issue) will almost undoubtedly make him overbearing in solo play, I think.
As a Xerath main I agree, he's in a good state already, any buffs will only make him incredibly unfair to play against.

The only buff I want is the ability to leave ult while snared.  It is quite annoying when you would be able to win if you retaliated with your stun, but because you can't move, you have to wait until you finish all the ult shots.

Sure you can say that if you get hit while ulting you should be punished, but you already kind of are by being immobile and revealed during it.
